Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Lampros B
Reviews.Content: clean, comfortable, arrived early and gave me a superior room, friendly staff, didn't try breakfast, and most important, very fair price around 50euros/night. Recommended for short stays of 3-4 night for city breaks

Reviews.Title: “Close to the metro.”
Reviews.Author: LondonBluebird
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. There are 2 hotel buildings next to each other, I checked in at one and my room was in the other, although they both have a reception desk. The room was perfectly reasonable, nothing plush, but it did the job. The one thing I will say is that the walls are very thin and there was lots of banging around from other rooms. No noise from outside though. There is a really nice bakery on a corner next to the hotel and the metro Gregorio Marinon is a 3 minute walk away. You can also leave your bags at reception after you've checked out, they give you a ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: damand
Reviews.Content: Zurbano is a modern, clean, well-run hotel. The room was adequately spacious, and everything worked as it should. WiFi was available in the lobby, but we also discovered that it would work in our room. The room was comfortable and the staff was very helpful and patient. The down side? Location. Not great for a tourist. This part of town is not especially interesting and there weren't a huge number of restaurant choices in the neighborhood. It's a couple of blocks from the Metro, which is an excellent system, so we were able to access other areas of Madrid fairly easily.

Reviews.Title: “Buildings 1 & 2”
Reviews.Author: Kris K
Reviews.Content: There are 2 separate buildings in this hotel. The one that has a restaurant is an old one. When we arrived, we were given the newer one and quite satisfied with it. We needed to visit somewhere for a week and decided to return to NH Zurbano for 2 days before we returned home. Then, we were given the old building this time! The interior(room and corridor) needs "update" - from the walls to the floors. The most inconvenient thing was, the restaurant did not open everyday!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Ms-G-Ali
Reviews.Content: One the first night I was given a tidy, clean and presentable bedroom. On the second night I stayed, I was given a room not to the same standards as the first night as the bathroom was untidy and the bathtub was stained- not pleasant! However this was not the main problem, the main problem was the awful customer service at the reception desk. I had trouble accessing the internet in the lobby and when I informed the receptionist, she barked at me in a rude manner saying that the WIFI was down. When proceeded to ask how long would it be before it was working again, she completely ignored me, gave me a dirty look and walked off into the office (and I'm sure your not allowed to leave a desk unattended.) I had the 'pleasure' of having to ask her this question twice and she was still so unwilling to respond. If you don't like helping people, don't work in a hotel- it's that simple! When I finally went up to my room, there was a lovely 'welcome gift' for me in the toilet...so that tells me that they don't care too much about standards. A few hours later I went back to the reception desk and there was a male night receptionist working who in contrast was very helpful and printed out a document for me. Overall, I definately won't be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in Northern Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MJakobson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel during a business trip. The hotel was nice, the breakfast was just supertb, but the room had some shortcomings. First of all, it seems that there are practically no non-smoking rooms in the hotel. So you'll have to do with the smell of traces of saturated cigaret smoke. Secondly, at least in our room, the air-conditioning was very modestly working. Additionally, the free internet that is advertised, is only available in the hotel lobby. You can take a free voucher and use the internet for 30 minutes. The positive side is the polite staff and the possibility to store your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A few nights in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rajinder M
Reviews.Content: I was visiting last weekend (3rd till the 5th June), and firstly I was impressed with the location of the hotel. The underground station is a short walking distance of about 5 min. The hotel was very clean and the reception staff were warm and welcoming. The room itself was a decent size, but It would have been nice if it were a bit bigger. The only downside were the beds, as they has wooden flooring in the room, the beds would easily move, hence the constant re-adjustments. The bathroom was clean, with a good hot shower, and with some comments from other posts, they do now provide complimentary single toothbrushes and toothpaste etc. Did not dine at the hotel resturant so I have no comments to post. There are a few restaurants around the hotel and a convenience shop with is located about 5 min walk from the hotel incase you need to pic up a few essentials/snacks etc. But overall if your looking for a few nights stay within a good location (a few short stops by train to central Madrid), excellent transport links, and which is not very far from the Real Madrid stadium I may add, then I would highly recommend this hotel, without leaving a big hole in the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel, but altogether lackluster”
Reviews.Author: gillesbourdier01
Reviews.Content: The NH Zurbano has quite a few favorable qualities: a nice modernly furnished big room, a well appointed bathroom with not so frequent amenities such as toothbrush, toothpaste, razor with shaving foam, The beds are very nice, with an excellent balance of firmness and comfort The hotel is well situated in a sidestreet 300 metres from Greogrio Maranon Metro station. One short ride takes you to the Nuevos Ministerios station where you can catch the Metro line 8 taking you straight to the Airport. The area is safe and quite pleasant, though not central. However even this may not be anything the Hotel management may fully control, There was quite a lot of noise from the street ( not the cars, but people yelling and screaming in the middle of the night) as well as from within the hotel itself: obnoxious and loud customers returning at the hotel well after midnight and bellowing in the rudest manner. Front desk personnel did not all have an adequate command of English, and finally Breakfast was only so so. I would return if I had to, but given a chance, I would try elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Tired room and smelt of urine!”
Reviews.Author: Patchpup
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently. Paid over €100 per night for a tired old hotel room that smelt of urine. Moved to another room that also smelt bad....think it was the aircon! Hotel on a quiet street 4 stops on the metro to Gran Via station. Only decent thing was nice breakfast and free minibar included in rate. Took the contents home!

Reviews.Title: “Business Class...Almost”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the claim of being a business class hotel except for two very important items. The rooms do not have irons and there are no irons at the front desk to even borrow! Also, the 'free' internet connection applies only to the lobby so I'd have to haul my laptop down to the lobby anytime I wanted to send reports or connect with anyone back home. Did I mention that the 'free' internet is allocated to guests in 30 minute increments? So, every 30 minutes you must get another slip of paper from the front desk with the different user name and password and login again. Some of my collegues gave up and just paid the 11.75 EUR rate for 24-hour high(er) speed service in their room. The biggest positive was the great complimentary breakfast. They have a great selection of breakfast foods and beverages!

Reviews.Title: “A mediocre hotel. Not a 3*”
Reviews.Author: Vladimir T
Reviews.Content: Definitely, not a 3* hotel. Was surprised by how bad an NH hotel can be. - If you unlucky, you need to go for breakfast to another building. It’s getting funny when raining outside. - No iron available in the whole hotel. Just laundry service. - Leaking tubes in the bathroom. - No soap/shampoo refreshments after room clean-up. - Sound isolation between rooms is questionable. - No restrooms near the lobby or breakfast place. - They charged the whole price from my card at the booking moment. Is that a kind of business to loan a few hundred euro for a month? The hotel was chosen by my corp. travel dept. for business trip as one of the affiliated hotels in Madrid. I will recommend to my colleagues to avoid this hotel, and travel dept. to review the hotels list. -Vladimir

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport subway and Ministerio de Fumento”
Reviews.Author: Ribez
Reviews.Content: I had a late arrival and it was strange when I came to reception, made check in but after that I was sent to another door. It is a hotel in two separate buildings and It is not funny when you have to go to breakfast if you don't have an umbrella.... Room is small, furniture old, bathroom even older. They offer free 30 minutes wi-fi in reception so there is always a lot of people with lap-tops. Location is great if you are looking for accomodation in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport, Center, and Suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Randy71
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel because I needed to access the suburb trains (Cercanias), but also wanted to be able to get to the airport and to the center conveniently. It's a short 10 minute walk from Nuevos Ministerios metro (where I caught the airport and suburb lines), and a 5 minute walk to the metro line that took me right to Chueca/the center. The single room was relatively small, but not too bad. The hotel area is quiet, but only a few blocks away from a nice row of restaurants and tapas bars. There's some mini grocery stores around the corner, for those extra staples. And the minibar was at least reasonable for minibar prices -- a water was 2.50 (euro). I had paid the extra 10 euros for the early checkin at 8, and unfortunately the hotel was booked, so I wasn't able to get into the room until about 10 -- but they were very apologetic and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm tired of business hotels like this one... Small room, worn bathroom with mould in the shower and hair (not mine!) on the floor and in the sink, 2 tiny single beds pushed together with horribly old and scratchy woolen blankets, armchairs you dont want to sit in for fear you'll catch something. Ok, so I'm probably making it sound worse than it was but how difficult can it be?!? I will definitely not come back or recommend this to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable internet pricing and procedures”
Reviews.Author: 505badgolfer
Reviews.Content: I ended up in this hotel as a result of blind bidding on Priceline. I paid $68 per night, taxes included, for a double. The hotel is about 150 yards from the Gregorio Maranon metro station. That metro station is 5 stops from Sol, with one transfer. The hotel is also about 400 yards from the outstanding Sorolla museum. I was originally placed in a single room that was microscopic in size. When I advised the desk clerk that I had booked a double through Priceline, he apologized and said “he did not know the rooms in the hotel that well.” The double I was placed in was of adequate size and modernity. This hotel is one of dwindling number that believes that it can get away with charging for internet service. It charges a whopping 10.6 Euros per day for wifi service in the room. It offers free wifi service in the lobby for a miserly 30 minutes per day. The hotel offers an expensive breakfast buffet for 14 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “standard 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: fran07Belgium
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice during November, >Room just ok but make sure thta you reserve a double room for single use rather than a single one because this last one really small. Good restaurant choice around the hotel. Staff professional but not really friendly. I would choose NH Abascal or NH Prisma which are in the same area but with better installations.

Reviews.Title: “Tolerable for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: andreawwt
Reviews.Content: Romos in the ole building are small, fue irise and comforter very old and looked dirty. Breakfast was very good. Free wireles Internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but it's all you need.”
Reviews.Author: yasha7686
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have been in a better location. Using the metro is so easy, so you can easily go anywhere in the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable and just what a tourist needs. The only thing they could improve on is having internet in the rooms, as of now you must go to the lobby for access.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley a must place to stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Disc0vering
Reviews.Content: After our miserable stay with Hesperia hotel, we’ve checked in at NH Zurbano. on the 18th of September. This hotel is located away from the main street which means it offer you a good sleep without disturbing noises from the street or bars. May I say that this change of hotel made our 5 days visit a truly memorable one to us! First of all the Warm greetings from the reception staff was truly genuine and makes you feel home! The staff was very helpful and spoke English very well too! Also the receptionist is always in the mood for an explanation of ‘his town’ and the very best markets for food, drinks and useful tips. The hotel location is just a 5 minutes walk from the metro station Gregorio Maranon at paseo La Castellana. NH Zurbano offer free Internet connection in the lobby by using unlimited vouchers for each time segments of 30 minutes (lobby use only). Our room (264) were spotlessly clean, spacious and well furnished. Have a nice comfy “double bed” with each side two large pillows and well-maintained clean bathroom! Both towels and bed linen were changed daily. The double bed consist of two beds with wheels under them so make sure they are set to brake position, otherwise they might roll away leaving you with twin beds with an unexpected gap between them. There are also tea and coffee making facilities in the room plus a safety locker. Even the ironing facility is available in our room! We’ve stayed at the building (nr. 79) next to the traffic light. There are two buildings of Zurbana hotel (nr.79 & 81) The other building is where the breakfast room is located. So, every morning we had a fresh air walk before we entered the breakfast room. Breakfast is very good. There are several alternatives for a HEALTHY and anti oxidant breakfast selections. Staff are always polite. They helped us out with whatever we needed and here are exactly the same two espresso machines available as in Hesperia hotel but most important to us; they are well maintained and functioning very well indeed. Bravo! NH Zurbano is just The great place to stay for a city break to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: Samada
Reviews.Content: Myself and 11 others stayed here for a long weekend recently. Rooms were spotless if a little small (one couple got a single room!) Great location to explore the city - near tube station with access to Madrid city centre just a couple of stops down the line and easy accessible from the airport. We had a 3 day travel pass for 13 euros each which covers all buses and trains as well as the train from the airport so excellent value. 24 hour tea and coffee (only discovered on the last morning, as not informed by the reception staff) is located in the dining area if you are not having meals at the hotel; mini bars available in room. Weren't exactly given a warm welcome either. Would recommend though and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, low-rates, well located”
Reviews.Author: dienteperro
Reviews.Content: I need to stay for a night in Madrid and call for a reservation to the NH call center, they gave me as a low-cost option this hotel, i was a bit worry about what to find when in the room, but the service is on par to others on superior class NH hotels, the service is very good, the personnel is charming and fast, the rooms are clean and well fitted, everything is where it must be. The internet is free on the lobby, paid on rooms, this hotel located in a very "pija" area of Madrid have prices on par to hostels in the centric area of Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...;..well located and easy on the wallet”
Reviews.Author: P Yesu T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days on a holiday and were quite happy with it. Being a three star hotel, they do not have bell boys and we had to cart our luggage by ourselves from reception to the next building where our room was. The room was reasonably spacious and well furnished with a mini bar and safety locker but no coffee/tea making facilities. The double bed consist of two beds with wheels on them and, if you are not careful, one of them might roll away leaving you with twin beds with an unexpected gap between them! They provide nice toiletries and, while you may come out of the shower smelling like an apple or an orange, you have to appreciate their commitment to the green cause. There was a good spread at the "anti oxidant" breakfast which had a few healthy options in addition to the usual stuff. (Avoid the scrambled eggs.) The absence of a proper restaurant for lunch and dinner is not a problem as there are a number of nice eating places nearby. The staff at reception speak English and are helpful. Internet is free only in the lobby. The metro is close by and a taxi to the center of town costs about seven euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, I like this hotel a lot.”
Reviews.Author: VaConnie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It has free Internet connection in the lobby. Front desk staff was kind, helpful, and spoke English. This hotel is very close to the metro, so I thought that was a plus. Our flight got in early in the morning, but they let us go to our rooms even though we weren't supposed to go to our room till about 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, room rate ok but everything else a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Starfield11
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying here and just dropped more than 110eur for laundry. The room rate is not bad and it's close to the office so the secretary booked it. But everything else is a rip-off. 18EUR for a breakfast that is nothing special and consists of those cheap textureless (powder) scrambled eggs. Laundry is a rip-off: 4 shirts and a few socks, underwear and t-shirts set me back more than 110EUR. But then again, breakfast and laundry are overpriced everywhere. The rooms are decent enough and clean, although the shower/bath seems to stem from the 1980s and the hose for the shower is too short and basically makes it difficult to stand underneath the shower head. The beds are ok, although request a king size bed because the double beds are annoying as a solo traveller because the other bed rolls away (basically you have to watch out if you don't want to end up on the floor between the beds. The biggest nuisance in this hotel is the internet. They advertise as having free internet, however that is only the case in the lobby. If you are a frequent business traveller and want to contact your loved ones at home, I strongly suggest to stay somewhere else. The internet in the rooms are horrible: Speed is ok but the overpriced outsourced deal with Swisscom is ridiculous. I paid 10.60EUR for a 24 hour period but the internet keeps dropping off every 25 minutes of Skype (a 50MB upload limit after which it kicks you off the internet and you sometimes have to go as far as turn off wireless and turn it back on because the system doesn't always go back to the login screen). Now I don't mind paying 11EUR per 24 hour period of internet (although it is still an insane amount of money if you are staying in this hotel three weeks), but the least you should get is unlimited internet, or at least an internet service that does not cut off skype calls every 25min. I think NH and Swisscom really show that they don't have service in mind at all by offering such a poor level of service for a high price. If you are staying in Madrid for a longer period of time, it's probably better to get a dongle. Next time I will ask the secretary to book another hotel that has decent internet....Perhaps a good tip for tripadvisor, let guests objectively rate the internet in a hotel because the current icon about free internet is misleading in so many ways...Business traveller beware of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent value”
Reviews.Author: salesharks60
Reviews.Content: I always post on trip advisor and give an objective critique. Stayed in this hotel recently for 2 nights on a wedding trip to Madrid. There were 30 of us in the hotel. It is well situated as has been alluded to in previous posts. Check in was fine but they neglected to tell us that our room was in the building next door until we had already gone up in the lift. All the reception staff spoke English. Our rooms were very good with large bed and an excellent clean bathroom and mini bar. Some of our friends had the mini bar thrown in as part of the package but we didn't. For some reason the BBC news channel sound packed in after the first night. There are no tea and coffee making facilites in the room and for us Brits this is not good.. Hotel management take note. There was some noise from the street late at night but you can expect this in a city centre hotel. Breakfast had a very good selection but the two hot options were very poor, bacon and scrambled egg. The SE was inedible, but everythinbg else was ok. There was only one small domestic kettle in the dining room to make tea and obly 3 small teapots. When I got there the kettle had run out of water and although i assked for a refill it took over ten minutes. There did not seem to be enough staff on the breakfast room. The hotel bar is staffed by one person and when all out part plus others descended he could not cope. He ran out of beer glasses and we were served beer in wine glasses. Also quite expensive. The check out time is a very generous 12 noon and they look after your cases for you from then. They will also let you keep your room later for an hourly supplement. A very good value for money hotel in a major city. We paid £145 for 2 nights. Would be lucky to get that for 1 night in London. Reccommend but please management give us Brits decent tea facilities and some better cooked food at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louis B
Reviews.Content: I really recommend to upgrade to a deluxe room, it is worth it! Very nice decor, space and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lonek
Reviews.Content: Not bad if you're doing business in the area, clean, good breakfast, also located near a metro station. The staff were usually friendly, some could speak some English. On the downside, the WiFi Internet is free in the lobby only, and upon request they are providing guests with a voucher to use it free in the bedroom for one hour a day. Weird. On the other hand they offer free minibar as a bonus which is nice, and a bit unusual, too. But this (as well as the breakfast) depend on the offer you get, so read the smallprint. They also do not inform about this upon checkin, unless asked.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, this hotel is 2 buildings, one ok and one BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: clonNewport
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Zurbano for one night while on a business trip to Madrid. I picked it because it was central, close to the metro and the reviews were ok. My company paid €150 for the night. The hotel is 2 separate buildings, I managed to be put into the one closest to the metro stop. Basicially the hotel was tired and tatty and very noisy. The room was small and needed a big makeover, no free internet. After along day travelling I was looking forward to a relaxing night but this was far from the case, I was continually woken by people just walking down the corridor and doors opening. I have stayed in better travellodges that cost £20 per night. I was disappointed and expected more from the NH brand as I have stayed with them many times in Munich. Take my advice - stay at the hoilday inn, I should have.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SWBA
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the NH Zurbano. Check in staff were helpful, breakfast was the typical european style, location was no more than 300m from a metro stop on a side street so awa from the main road which ment it was nice and quiet, massive beds, clean shower and bathroom. A very good base for Madrid and will definetely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “What a 5 day!”
Reviews.Author: squaresushi
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying in Spain. Madrid is a beautiful city (I don't know if it can race against Barcelona, but..) Zurbano Hotel has a great location. We rented a car but if you choose to walk, it takes only 10 - 15 minutes to reach the city center. Hotel's food, especially pizza and breakfast was delicious. The only problem is, nobody even receptionists does not know English -except a guy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Erron
Reviews.Content: Me and my high school tour group stayed at this hotel from March 26 to April 1. Overall this was a great hotel with nice clean rooms and within walking distance of many resturants and subway stations. The breakfast was also very good :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: JoggingScots
Reviews.Content: Check -in involves going from one building to another (a bit confusing) but all the staff we met spoke good English and were helpful even though they were very busy. The room was clean and comfortable and we had no problems with our bathroom (see other reviews). It looked like the place was being refurbished but there was no mess or noise to spoil our stay. A great location close to metro station Gregorio Maranon so it's easy to see all the sights or enjoy the nightlife. (Watch out for pickpockets on the metro though)

Reviews.Title: “Good reasonably-priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopefultraveller_9
Reviews.Content: My room was at the rear of the hotel overlooking the stairwells and was extremely quiet (I had requested a quiet room.) The downside of that was that there was no view of any kind and not much natural daylight. The room was also cold.There are controls in the room to heat it up,but that takes time. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are kept clean.The bathrooms too with a nice range of products. I was not made aware that a cooked breakfast could be ordered in the restaurant.(see a prevoius review) Breakfast was alright - not too much choice but a good range of fruit smoothies. The weekend rate was reasonable with breakfast and free mini-bar included. About 20/30 min walk to the tourist sights ot Madrid -pleasant area.

Reviews.Title: “AN AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: madtogetaway
Reviews.Content: we just returned from madrid today after spending 4 days in the above hotel. can i just start by saying that we have had several european city breaks and this hotel is BY FAR the best we have ever stayed in. It is spotlessly clean and both towels and bed linen are changed daily. You are offered a selection of different pillows...now isn't that a bonus in comparison to most hotels where you usually get 1 hard lumpy pillow!!! the bath and shower products were of very high quality and were amply supplied. the breakfast menu is extensive to say the least and covers all dietary requirements. the fruit and bread selection were both fresh and varied. there was a selection of juices and smoothies to choose from also. We also had the option of having a freshly cooked breakfast prepared for us daily at no extra cost. internet access was free to all guests and hotel reception provided us with vouchers for use of same whenever we wanted. There is also free WI-FI throughout the hotel. there is a mini bar in each bedroom filled with the usual selection of drinks etc.. and when we were checking out today we were told there was no charge for the 6 bottles of still water we had drank during our stay. the staff were really lovely and helpful and could not do enough to help us. Im amazed at the value and service this hotel has to offer and felt i had to recommend the NH Zurbano to Tripadvisor immediately. In fact if there is anyone thinking of going to Madrid in the future, don't stay anywhere else...... 10 out of 10. It Is Just Perfect for a city break to madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but reliable and functional”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoLP
Reviews.Content: A typical business-traveler hotel, with good service, pleasant and clean rooms (even if a bit on the small side), good internet connection and good breakfast. While I would not choose it for a romantic weekend, it's a solid choice for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location/Stay that is close to transport and sites.”
Reviews.Author: fastball16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights recently. Let me say that the location is important. The hotel is a block from the #10 (I think) Blue line of the Metro. So this place is a great gateway for Plaza del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Prado, Retiro, Ventas (Bullfighting), and the Opera. The rooms are spacious with the modern, dark Oak look and feel. The bathroom was sufficient as well. Very clean and the staff are very detailed in cleanliness. Interesting though, the staff kept to themselves and the one receptionist was showing way too much chest hair. I would recommend this place for travelers that don't want to stay in the jam-packed center of town and would like to be close to the airport and the rest of the city/sites/rail. The place is very clean and comfortable, and would fit any budget minded traveler. Please don't stay here if you're looking for a spa or 5 * (star) accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the new wing, but pleased in general.”
Reviews.Author: Sirus745
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Zurbano twice- December 2008 and January 2009. The first time we stayed in the new "wing", which is right beside the main Zurbano. The rooms are a bit small and the bathroom planning is desired to be better! By the time we were ready to leave, my legs were black and blue. Not sure if it was my clumsiness, but I managed to locate with my knees every sharp corner in that small space. The conceirge service.... hmmm.. was absolutely useless!!!! Didn't have a clue about anything at all. If you are planning to stay there, ask to stay in the mainZurbanho, the rooms are better, service is great and the atmosphere is less cold in general. Make a note that the Metro stop (Gregorio Maranion) is about 5 min walk from the Hotel. If you arrive at night, you can still use the Metro, I believe it runs through the whole night, but only to a designated Metro stop , which is located about 10-15 min walking from the hotel. We learnt it the hard way. Avoid to take taxis at all cost (because of all surcharges you will have to pay), better spend that money in "Botin" restaurant. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “OK but don't expect anything too special!”
Reviews.Author: retsnuf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Zurbano as part of a work trip to Madrid. It was OK, but don't expect anything special. Other NH hotels in Madrid are better, as are at least one or two others I've stayed at in the city before. Things got off to a bad start when - after checking in twice (there are two distinct and separate buildings!) - I got into my allocated room and was overwhelmed by a very distinctive aroma. Not flowers, nor perfume..... No - in this case it was sewage! I expect there was a drainage problem. I was given a Deluxe room instead. Bigger, with a separate bathroom, and more plush soft furnishings. It was comfortable enough, despite the cleaners having a habit of setting the thermostat to 30c every day! The bathroom left rather a lot to be desired. Broken tiles, mildew on the bath sealant, a shower curtain that barely covered the bath. Everything worked though. Location is good. No more than a couple of minutes from the Gregorio Maranon Metro station and there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. At a push, I'd stay again, but if I had the choice, I'd pick somewhere else in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel from which to traverse Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Madrid was simplified by the NH Zurbano's convenient location, 2 blocks away from the Gregoria Maranon metro stop and 2 blocks away from Paseo de la Castellana. Although the hotel is situated north of central Madrid, we found it very easy to get around using public transportation. The hotel itself has 2 entrances side by side, and has a bizarre reservation system where you can only check-in at the entrance where the reservation is held. Otherwise, check-in was fine. It was nice to see that one entrance was completely wheelchair accessible, leading straight to the elevator inside. Our room was clean, though a bit outdated. The bed consisted of two twins pushed together. The bathroom, however, looked newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: kevi_d
Reviews.Content: Booked this as part of a weekend break. Having read other reviews, decided on this hotel. We were not disappointed. It is very easy to get to, being just a couple of minutes from the Gregoria Mananon metro station, and also not far from the Nuevos Ministerios station (if coming from the airport). The room was not huge, but was comfortable, very clean and well furnished. The same with the bathroom. The buffet breakfast selection was very good and delicious, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Unlike many other hotels nowadays, you had to pay to access the available wifi connectivity, which we opted against. That should really be inclusive. Nontheless, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MuseJam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Zurbano Hotel while I attended a nearby conference. The room was small but very adequate for my needs. It was clean and comfortable. There was a small, programmable safe in the room, which was much appreciated. Breakfast was included with my room, and was always fresh and delicious. The buffet has many cold items such as cereal and milk (they had soy milk!), fruit, coffee, toast with preserves, sliced meat, sweets such as donuts, many different fruit juices, and yogurts. If you wanted, you could order hot items for no extra charge. The room was always cleaned promptly and carefully, although some mornings the cleaning staff was rather early! the only downside to this hotel was that the walls were quite thin so it was very easy to hear other guests in surrounding rooms. The staff was excellent. Always prompt, helpful, and courteous. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to point...Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Been here in my trip to Madrid on December 2006, and I just need to say great things about this hotel! Although I think now it's a bit expensive, when I went there I had very good discounts. But to what concerns to the hotel itself, it's very clean, great breakfast...yes I recommend to everyone who wants to visit Madrid and have a nice place to rest at night after walking around Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: swisstravel
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay somewhere different this time and we like the neighborhood alot. It is right by the subway stop (G. Mannon) - very easy to get to from the airport. A few blocks up there are plenty of cafe/restaurants around. It is an easy subway ride away to all the sights. This is a typical NH hotel - the room is of good size with all the typical NH amenities. It is very clean. The staff is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Carlota_Joaquina
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel from Trip Advisor and based on quality / price, I decided to book it. They also do a wonderful package for "Warner Bros" theme park, so we took that deal via the hotel's own website. What a gem! Firstly, the hotel is very central and easy to find. It is located a short distance (even walking in some cases) from Madrid's main attractions. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is modern and very clean. It is a city hotel, so don't expect massive rooms. But, when compared to say, Paris, the room was very big. The bathroom could have been a little bigger, but I'm just being picky now! There are no real views as such, but we were just after somewhere to sleep, and this place was perfect. I liked the interiors (very modern and clean-cut). Breakfast was great. This really was a full-blown continental breakfast - none of that toast and coffee rubbish other places serve. You could have hot food, but we all opted for the ample cold buffet. We left stuffed! If you take your car, the hotel park is very expensive, but if you have foreign plates and park it in a legal space, you don't have that much to worry about, besides a standard ticket/fine (and we all know what to do with those!) If I ever go back to Madrid (which will probably be soon), I'll be staying there again. Really - very, very, happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: DouggyD
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying here, close to the city center and the airport. Nice rooms, and not very expensive at all. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A good 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Madrid from 4th August to 11th August and booked 7 nights in a doble NO-SMOKING room. When I arrived at the hotel, the reception said to me that there was or a small doble no-smoking room or a big doble smoking room. Fortunately, the big one that I've selected didn't taste of smoke. However, the room was very beautiful. The only hitch with the room was that in the bathroom there was a sewer's stanch and the cleaning woman put the air conditioning at 15°C. The hotel is very close (100 m) to the metro station Gregorio Maranon. From this station you can reach the centre of Madrid taking the metro line 10 (direction Puerta del Sur) and after 3 stops get down to metro stop Plaza de Espana (the centre of Madrid). The hotel is very excellent for the price, particulary if you are younger than 25 years old. The room costs 48€ (+ 7% IVA) and the breakfast costs 7€ (+7% IVA) for person.
